title: A journal of a residence ... in London; including excursions through various parts of England; and a short tour in France and Scotland; in the years 1823 and 1824
author: Wheaton, Nathaniel Sheldon.
snippet: The principal street which traverses the abovementionedis the North and South Bridge Street. By the North Bridge,thrown across the North Loch in front of the Register Office,it communicates with the New Town ; while by the SouthBridge, it is carried over the Cowgate, the latter street beingseen at a distance below. The North Bridge is a noble andexpensive work.

title: A Bit of the Tartan; or, Two fragments of romance
author: Colquhoun, Frances Mary.
snippet: I dashed down the wide staircase, where the guests werestill arriving, and hurried up the Canongate to the SouthBridge, whence I pushed forward, having no settled purposein my poor bewildered brain !

title: Reheated Cabbage
author: Welsh, Irvine
snippet: upstairs in Jimmy's room playing those cheap tartan technotapes which they buy in the Asian discount store up the SouthBridge. Parental control had become a blurred concept sinceJimmy had filled out and met his old man's warning gazes withchallenging, hardened eyes.

title: Literary landmarks of Edinburgh,
author: Hutton, Laurence
snippet: ROBERT FERGUSON 35Lucky Middlemist's establishment in the Cowgatehas given place to the south pier of the SouthBridge. Another favorite resort of Ferguson's, where," wi' sang and glass he'd ﬂee the power o' care, thatwad harras the hour," was the Cape Club, which metat The Isle of Man's Arms, Craig's Close (265 HighStreet).
